title: Trial of notifications for NSW domestic violence survivors | ABC NEWS
description: During a 12-month pilot program, 'DV Notify' will alert survivors of domestic and family violence when an alleged perpetrator is released from custody.  Users will receive real-time text and email updates from the arrest until the final sentencing. title: Stabbing on London-bound train investigated by counterterrorism police | ABC NEWS
description: Police and emergency crews have rushed to Huntingdon Station in the UK after reports of multiple stabbings on a train bound for London. Two people have been arrested and police say 10 people have been taken to hospitals, nine of them with life-threatening injuries. title: Nationals formally abandon commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050 | ABC NEWS
description: The Nationals have formally abandoned a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, setting a challenge for the Liberals to follow.  David Littleproud has proposed linking emissions reduction efforts to the OECD average, and focusing on adaptation measures. title: Claims Royal Adelaide Hospital ED admitted more patients than beds | ABC NEWS
description: The Royal Adelaide Hospital has been accused of admitting more patients that it had beds in its emergency department on a day in September. The Australasian College of Emergency Medicine believes it’s the first time that has happened in an emergency department at any major hospital in the country. But SA Health has disputed the claim. title: Police believe stabbings on London-bound train not terror-related | ABC NEWS
description: Police in the UK say they do not believe a mass stabbing on a London-bound train was linked to terrorism.  The attack left one person fighting for their life and 10 others injured.  A witnessed praised the train driver for stopping the service at Huntingdon Station in Cambridgeshire to allow for a police intervention. title: Three arrested after alleged abduction of 42-year-old man in Sydney's southwest | ABC NEWS
description: Three people have been arrested after an alleged kidnapping of a 42-year-old man from his Riverwood home in Sydney’s southwest.  NSW Police allege they subsequently found the man in the process of being assaulted by a 44-year-old woman and two men aged 28 and 33 in an apartment complex on Susan Street in Auburn. Investigators also found cable ties and batons in a SUV believed to be linked to the incident. title: First home buyers and investors drive up capital city property prices | ABC NEWS
description: Property prices have risen across all Australian capital cities, as auctions reached new highs in October.  Real estate research firm Cotality found a national surge of 1.1 per cent in home values over the month, while industry rival PropTrack produced similar data.  Perth, Adelaide and Darwin led the charge, while the median house value in Sydney notched the $1.2 million mark.  ABC News presenter Emma Rebellato attributes the spike to first-home buyers buoyed by the expansion of the federal government’s first-home deposit scheme and investors already in the market. title: Is China building missiles with our critical minerals? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Vast reserves of Australian critical minerals will be mined, processed and exported under a deal the prime minister has struck with US President Donald Trump.    But Australia’s already exporting plenty of zirconium to China and it can be used in everything from bathroom tiles to missiles and nuclear reactors.    Today, Four Corners reporter Angus Grigg reveals how Australian critical minerals could end up aiding the advancement of Chinese military capabilities, including the construction of advanced hypersonic missiles.    How will Australia balance its trade ambitions with the risk of supporting China's military machine, which analysts regard as a key threat to Australia’s national security?    Featured:    Angus Grigg, Four Corners reporter

title: Will the Liberals follow the Nationals in dumping net zero commitment? | ABC NEWS
description: The Nationals have formally announced the party is ditching its commitment to net zero emissions by 2050, and instead will focus on climate adaptation. The Liberal Party is still considering its position, and is expected to finalise an energy review this year. The Nationals have pointed to rising electricity prices as a reason for the change in policy, while the government has accused the party of betraying regional Australia in making the move. description: Many skilled migrant women find it hard to get a job in Australia as either their qualifications are not recognised or they are told they have no Australian work experience. title: Canberra is a step closer to getting its first dementia care village | ABC NEWS
description: In the ACT, there is no dedicated dementia care village — but that is about to change.  The ACT government's Suburban Land Agency has sold an unused site in Canberra's south so it can house those with dementia.  HammondCare bought the Curtin property and said it will build 11 cottages with 90 beds. title: Australia sells China critical minerals vital for Beijing's weapon programs | ABC NEWS
description: An ABC investigation has uncovered that Australia is selling China critical minerals crucial to Beijing’s military build-up, despite the Albanese government openly declaring support for Washington's bid to break China's domination in the critical minerals sector.  One of these minerals is zirconium (Zr), an essential ingredient used in protective coating for hypersonic missiles, submarines and aircraft carriers and nuclear propulsion and fuel systems.  A research paper by the Chinese People’s Liberation Army has highlighted China's vulnerability to a zirconium shortage, but Australia is still exporting the mineral sand to Chinese buyers while spending billions of dollars on countering Chinese military expansion.  ABC Four Corners reporter Angus Grigg says there is a clear conflict between Canberra's trade policy and security interests. title: ACT voluntary assisted dying scheme begins, allowing Canberrans to 'die with dignity' | ABC NEWS
description: Warning: The following video contains content that viewers may find distressing.  November 3 marks the beginning of the ACT's voluntary assisted dying scheme, making the territory the second-last Australian jurisdiction to legalise it.   For Canberran Gail Ford, it's about "choice" and "dignity".   Over the more than 20 years that Gail has lived with Parkinson's disease, it has steadily and determinedly stripped away her abilities, and her independence.  For those reasons and more, Gail wants the option of voluntary assisted dying.   "Everyone should have that ability because death for many people is not dignified and it's not pleasant," she said  If you or anyone you know needs help: Lifeline on 131 114 Kids Helpline on 1800 551 800 Beyond Blue on 1300 224 636 13 YARN on 13 92 76 Suicide Call Back Service on 1300 659 467 MensLine Australia on 1300 789 978 Headspace on 1800 650 890 ReachOut SANE on 1800 187 263 Call triple-0 if you need immediate care  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-03/act-voluntary-assisted-dying-scheme-begins-die-with-dignity/105960688  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad.
